name: Trumpet Vine
climate: Thrives in a temperate climate where winters are cool and summers are warm.
Can tolerate a wide range of temperatures but prefers mild climates.
Not suitable for very cold climates; needs protection from frost.
Grows best in areas where average temperatures do not drop too low.
sunlight: Requires full sun for optimal growth and vibrant blooms.
Can tolerate partial shade, but flowering may be reduced.
Sunlight exposure of at least six hours a day is recommended.
Best flowering occurs in consistently sunny locations.
watering: Water regularly during the growing season to keep the soil moist.
Allow the top few inches of soil to dry out between waterings.
Once established, the plant is fairly drought tolerant.
Do not overwater to prevent root rot; ensure good drainage.
soil: Prefers well-drained soil that is fertile and rich in organic matter.
Can adapt to a range of soil types but performs best in loam.
Avoid heavy clay soils that can lead to waterlogging issues.
Adding compost can improve soil structure and fertility.
toxic: Toxic if ingested by pets and humans, causing gastrointestinal upset.
Handling the plant may cause skin irritation or allergic reactions.
extra_care_tip: Regular pruning can control its vigorous growth and shape the plant.
Train the vine on trellises or arbors for structure support.
